name: BANCO BILBAO VIZCAYA ARGENTARIA
goal:
Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria (BBVA) is a global financial group with a leading position in the Spanish market and it is the biggest financial institution in Mexico. BBVA has also leading franchises in South America and the Sunbelt region in the U.S, as well as significant presence in Turkey (through strategic investments in Garanti Bank) and operates an extensive network of branches worldwide.

BBVA employs about 132.000 people in more than 30 countries around the world, has 72 million customers and about 900.000 shareholders. Through a network of 8.374 branches, BBVA manages € 691 billion assets.

BBVA’s European Affairs Office is in charge of the Relations with European Institutions and ensures the follow-up of any European regulatory activity having a potential impact for BBVA, particularly in the field of financial services. Our main mission is to share with the European policy makers our experience in the banking sector and to promote a business model based on principles such as integrity, prudence, transparency and Corporate Social Responsibility, which is one of our core values. BBVA firmly believes that putting principles first in managing the Group’s governance is in itself a source of competitive advantage.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives: BBVA’s Brussels Office aims to share its experience and expertise with the European policy makers and contribute to economic recovery and prosperity. In this context, our follow-up exercise covers EU regulatory initiatives in the field of financial services (Banking Union; prudential requirements CRR/CRD, Capital Markets, retail banking, payments, structural reforms in the banking sector, sustainable finance, etc.), as well as other EU initiatives of interest for BBVA, for example in the area of Digital economy, Innovation and Technology, Corporate Governance and Company Law, Audit, Consumer Protection, Competition, Taxation, Corporate Social Responsibility, among others.
